description: Validates an existing pull through cache rule for an upstream registry that requires authentication. This will retrieve the contents of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret, verify the syntax, and then validate that authentication to the upstream registry is successful.

parameters.name: ecrRepositoryPrefix
parameters.description: The repository name prefix associated with the pull through cache rule.

nested_items.name: ecrRepositoryPrefix
nested_items.description: The Amazon ECR repository prefix associated with the pull through cache rule.

nested_items.name: registryId
nested_items.description: The registry ID associated with the request.

nested_items.name: upstreamRegistryUrl
nested_items.description: The upstream registry URL associated with the pull through cache rule.

nested_items.name: credentialArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager secret associated with the pull through cache rule.

nested_items.name: customRoleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role associated with the pull through cache rule.

nested_items.name: upstreamRepositoryPrefix
nested_items.description: The upstream repository prefix associated with the pull through cache rule.

nested_items.name: isValid
nested_items.description: Whether or not the pull through cache rule was validated. If true, Amazon ECR was able to reach the upstream registry and authentication was successful. If false, there was an issue and validation failed. The failure reason indicates the cause.

nested_items.name: failure
nested_items.description: The reason the validation failed. For more details about possible causes and how to address them, see Using pull through cache rules in the Amazon Elastic Container Registry User Guide.
